message.text: Discover your first steps using Main methods and Terminators. These elements form the basic entry point and syntax of every program.

chapterIntro.title: Welcome to Java Programming
chapterIntro.description: This chapter introduces the structural backbone of any Java application. You will learn about the entry point of programs and how to output information to the console.

objectives.text: Understand the structure of the Main Method
Learn the role of the semicolon as a statement terminator

chapterOutro.title: Syntax Success!
chapterOutro.description: You can now write valid Java statements and execute a basic program. This fundamental skill is the requirement for all future coding tasks.

sneakPeaks.text: Next, we explore storing data using Variables and Data Types. You will learn how to keep information saved in memory.

conclusion.text: The foundation is built and you are ready to start handling data. Your journey into professional development starts here.

message.text: Master the difference between Primitive and Reference variables. Understanding memory allocation is key to writing efficient software.

chapterIntro.title: Variables and Data Types
chapterIntro.description: Learn how Java stores information in memory using various data sizes. We will explore how objects are referenced and how primitives behave differently.

objectives.text: Master primitive types and reference variables

chapterOutro.title: Data Mastery!
chapterOutro.description: You now understand how to define the state of your application using variables. Storing information correctly is the first step toward complex logic.

sneakPeaks.text: Up next, we will be making decisions with If-Else and Switch statements. This will allow your code to choose different paths.

conclusion.text: Data is the core of software and you have learned how to store it safely. You are now prepared to build functional programs.

message.text: Start making decisions within your code using If and Switch blocks. These tools allow your program to react differently to various inputs.

chapterIntro.title: Decision Making in Code
chapterIntro.description: Programs need to act differently under different conditions to be useful. This chapter focuses on branching logic and logical evaluation.

objectives.text: Apply boolean logic to control flow

chapterOutro.title: Logic Unlocked!
chapterOutro.description: Your programs are no longer linear and can now branch based on data. This logic forms the 'brain' of your entire application.

sneakPeaks.text: Next, we will cover automation using various types of Loops. You will learn to repeat tasks without writing extra code.

conclusion.text: Control structures are the core logic of your code and you did a great job. Dynamic programming is now within your reach.

message.text: Automate repetitive tasks using For, While, and Do-While loops. Efficiency in coding comes from mastering these iterative structures.

chapterIntro.title: Repetitive Tasks
chapterIntro.description: Instead of writing the same code twice, learn to use loops to automate repetitive logic. This chapter covers the syntax and control of all major loop types.

objectives.text: Write efficient For loops for known iterations
Use While and Do-While for conditional repetition
Control loop execution with break and continue

chapterOutro.title: Automation Mastered!
chapterOutro.description: You can now handle large-scale tasks with just a few lines of code. This level of automation is what makes computers so powerful.

sneakPeaks.text: The final step involves communicating via Input and Output streams. You will learn to make your programs fully interactive.

conclusion.text: Loops allow you to harness the true speed of a computer processor. You have successfully scaled your programming capabilities.

message.text: Learn to read from users and write to streams to make interactive programs. This bridges the gap between the code and the end user.

chapterIntro.title: The Outside World
chapterIntro.description: Make your programs interactive by capturing user input and managing data streams. We will focus on the Scanner class and PrintStream management.

objectives.text: Capture user input with the Scanner class

chapterOutro.title: Course Completed!
chapterOutro.description: You have transitioned from basic syntax to interactive program handling. Your skills now cover the entire basic lifecycle of a Java application.

sneakPeaks.text: The next level involves Advanced Data Structures and GUI development. You are ready to build full-scale desktop applications.

conclusion.text: Congratulations on mastering the core foundations of Java programming. You have built a solid base for a career in software development.
